column4: I'm on 64bit ubuntu, Intrepid. I'm trying to install libc6-dev-i386, but I get: "libc6-dev-i386: Depends: libc6-i386 (= 2.8~20080505-0ubuntu7) but 2.8~20080505-0ubuntu9 is to be installed"... Is there a nice way to resolve this? (I'm trying to install a 32bit mplayer so I can get win32 codecs).
you will need to install libc6-i386
- It's already installed, but it's a different version...
what version do you have installed?
you could force install it, i'd check they are backward compatible
- They probably are, it's ubuntu build versions that differ...
if you are compiling 32bit stuffs i'd set up a chroot situation so you can flip between the 2 archs
- I'd prefer to just install 32bit mplayer in it's own directory. It's all I need, and fairly clean.
you could download the 32bit debs for mplayer and install but yuo will have to satisfy deps manually
- Wouldn't they complain about it being the wrong arch?
yes butyou can force it to install, you will also need to sudo apt-get install ia32-libs
ia32-libs allows you to run 32bit stuff
its gonna be messy for a bit getting the deps sorted
- Yes, I really don't want to mix 64bit and 32bit packages...

- It would be nice, though, if the packages in the repository fit together - then I wouldn't have this problem. Wouldn't I still have the dependency problem in a chroot environment? Or could I make a clean 32bit env. there?
they do, just for the installed arch, you are forcing some package installs so deps arent met well
